results.title: Vacation at Last: Prioritizing Child Development
results.summary: This commentary emphasizes the importance of children engaging in play and activities that foster social and emotional development during vacation. It warns against extending the school term into vacation, which can lead to stress and trauma. The article encourages parents to spend quality time with their children, building strong bonds and promoting healthy development. It advises against over-scheduling children with lessons, which can cheapen the educational experience and limit their potential. The author warns that "Our society is currently paying a heavy price for producing future adults who are social and emotionally maladjusted," advocating for balance in education. However, the article lacks a foundation in Biblical principles and spiritual growth.

title: Vacation at Last: Prioritizing Child Development
